Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "this.$route.fullPath etc not set on async route refresh" (#1730) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/benperiton/vue-router-issue](https://github.com/benperiton/vue-router-issue)

### Steps to reproduce
Clone the repo listed and install, then run yarn run dev.

Click to navigate to the users page.
Refresh the page and observe the console log.

Click the 'update' button and see that the correct values are set.

### What is expected?
That the this.$route.path and this.$route.fullPath properties are populated correctly

### What is actually happening?
They are set to '/' until the component requesting them is updated.

---
It seems that the route must be known for it to know which component to load, so populating the path details should be available from the beginning.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When initial route to non root route with lazy loading, this.$route not initialized in created and mounted events of root instance (App.vue)" (#1784) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.7.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Zysce/VueRouterRouteIssue](https://github.com/Zysce/VueRouterRouteIssue)

### Steps to reproduce
* get project [https://github.com/Zysce/VueRouterRouteIssue](https://github.com/Zysce/VueRouterRouteIssue)
* npm install
* npm run dev
* Navigate to link Hello (lazy loaded)
* Refresh browser 
* Look to data displayed on page

- When initial routing to root route (no params, no path), no problem
- When initial routing to route not lazy loaded, no problem
- When initial routing to route with lazy loading, this.$route not initialized in created and mounted of App.vue


### What is expected?
this.$route initialized to route (name, params, ...)  on created and mounted of vue instance

### What is actually happening?
this.$route not initialized on created and mounted of vue instance

---
I need url params in the mounted event.
Before adding lazy loading, no problem to access to data.
After setting up lazy loading, couldnt access to url params since this.$route is not initialized.
N.B : The initial routing needs to be a non root url with params.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "There is a problem with the status update" (#981) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi, thanks for your work.

## When I add an attribute to an object in an array,there is a problem with the status update
`
let initialState = {
  linkmans = []
}
`

`
state.linkmans.forEach((item) => {
  item.lastWord = 'xxx'
})
`
Because i did not initialize，it doesn't work
## Then i do it 
`
state.linkmans = Immutable.fromJS(state.linkmans).toJS()
`
it works， but i feel that this writing is not elegant， i would like to know vuex in the operation of complex data when there is no better way to write. Or should Use immutable.
